derivation.yuyuan_name: mid 19th cent.: from French sculpter, from sculpteur 'sculptor'; later regarded as a back-formation from sculptor or sculpture

entry.def: When an artist sculpts something, they carve or shape it out of a material such as stone or clay.

example.ex: An artist sculpted a full-size replica of her head...
example.tran: 一位艺术家按实际大小雕刻了一个她的头部模型。

example.ex: When I sculpt, my style is expressionistic.
example.tran: 我的雕刻风格是表现主义。

entry.def: If something is sculpted, it is made into a particular shape.

example.ex: More familiar landscapes have been sculpted by surface erosion...
example.tran: 还有更多熟悉的地貌是因地表侵蚀形成的。

example.ex: Michael smoothed and sculpted Jane's hair into shape.
example.tran: 迈克尔把简的头发梳理平整并做出发型。

means.word_mean: 1. create by shaping stone or wood or any other hard material;

sentences.sentence: "sculpt a swan out of a block of ice"

means.word_mean: 2. shape (a material like stone or wood) by whittling away at it;

sentences.sentence: "She is sculpting the block of marble into an image of her husband"

auth_sentence.content: With cosmetic surgery, we sculpt our bodies to create an ideal of attractiveness.

auth_sentence.res_content_con: With cosmetic surgery, we sculpt our bodies to create an ideal of attractiveness.

auth_sentence.content: After months in the hospital, Mr. di Suvero began to sculpt again from a wheelchair.

auth_sentence.res_content_con: After months in the hospital, Mr. di Suvero began to sculpt again from a wheelchair.

auth_sentence.content: But they both change shape noticeably as increasing amounts of sex hormones sculpt their bodies in different ways.

auth_sentence.res_content_con: But they both change shape noticeably as increasing amounts of sex hormones sculpt their bodies in different ways.

sentences.en: The ladies had their hair sculpted by the leading coiffeur of the day.
sentences.cn: 女士们的发型都是当代有名的理发师做的。
